**Cable Organizer**: Use a coat hanger to create a DIY cable organizer. Simply unwind the hanger and reshape it into a spiral or looped form. You can then wrap your cords and cables around the loops to keep them tangle-free and neatly stored. This is particularly useful for managing chargers, headphones, and other electronic cables.

**Book Holder**: Bend a coat hanger into a stand to hold your books open while you read or cook. By reshaping the hanger into an A-frame or a simple support, you can keep your hands free while you follow along with a recipe or enjoy a novel, making it a practical addition to your kitchen or reading nook.

**Plant Hanger**: Repurpose a coat hanger as a creative plant holder. By reshaping the hanger into a hook or a series of loops, you can suspend small pots of herbs or succulents from the ceiling or a wall bracket. This not only saves space but also adds a touch of greenery to your living area.

**Picture Frame**: Create a unique picture frame by bending a coat hanger into a rectangular shape. Attach a piece of cardboard or a canvas as the backing, and then use clips or clothespins to hold your photos or artwork in place. This DIY frame can be a fun way to showcase your favorite memories in an unconventional manner.

**Shoe Rack**: Use a coat hanger to make a makeshift shoe rack. By bending the hanger into a flat shape with multiple loops, you can hang several pairs of shoes from the hooks, keeping them organized and off the floor. This is particularly useful for small spaces or when you need a temporary storage solution.
